nodes.label: How to...
Win with this retailer
What does my category deliver to this retailer?

children.label: What is its role: to bring in Traffic or to drive Spend?
children.answer: Higher scores from shoppers on one or more of the "Traffic" measures indicate an ability to impact the trip before the store, whereas higher scores on "Spend" measures show impact once in the store.

children.label: Is it high or low engagement in this retailer?
children.answer: Shoppers tell us whether they intended this to be a high speed or more considered purchase (Grab and Go/Browse). And then if something changed this in store (either positively or negatively in their view).

children.label: Where does it sit in the Intentionality/Engagement Matrix?
children.answer: The 4 box matrix summarises the overall DNA of the category; identifying its position in the mix of the store for this retailer; high ratings on Intentionality and Engagement make this a more attractive category to invest in for the retailer. Each quadrant implies a different strategy.

children.label: Does this vary for different shopper types? Or for our brand versus others?
children.answer: Does the category role vary by age group, by income, by gender of shoppers?

children.label: How does our brand compare on the role implied by its shoppers?
children.answer: Do our brand shoppers show a different role profile? If so, our brand may be able to move the dial for the retailer.

children.label: How does this differ to other banners/channels?
children.answer: Is there anything unique about this retailer in the way the category operates?

nodes.label: What’s different about this retailer's shoppers?

children.label: Who shops at this retailer? (demographics, needs, behaviours)
children.answer: Are there certain shopper types that are more likely to shop at this retailer across its entire business, or within our "Department"? We need to think about orienting our marketing to suit their target market.

children.label: What Missions are this retailer's shoppers more likely to be on?
children.answer: Does this retailer show a prevalence of bigger or smaller shopping trips? How should our category play to that?

children.label: What do this retailer’s shoppers want?
children.answer: Do this retailer's shoppers want particular things? More than other banners? Particularly in our Department/category?

children.label: Is our category behaving differently at this retailer?
children.answer: What is the pattern of choices in this retailer compared to others, in our category?

children.label: Are certain shopper needs more prevalent for our category at this retailer?
children.answer: Are there occasions (users, times) that are more common for this retailer than others; in the Department or in our category?

nodes.label: Where is this retailer winning/losing?

children.label: Where does this retailer do better or worse than its key competitors?
children.answer: Looking at the store and this Department, how does it benchmark in shopper satisfaction on all measures to competitor banners? What are its strengths and weakenesses.

children.label: Where does this retailer do better or worse than its key competitors in 'net recommend' ratings?
children.answer: Looking at the store and this Department: How does it benchmark in Overall (net) recommend rating to competitor banners? What are its strengths and weaknesses?

children.label: Is this particularly true of certain shoppers?
children.answer: Are certain types of shoppers more satisfied? Or do they want particular improvements?

children.label: What improvements are shoppers at this retailer looking for?
children.answer: Looking at the store and this Department: Are shoppers in this retailer looking for particular improvements? Is this different to the norm?

children.label: How is their private label performing?
children.answer: How does Private Label perform in this retailer; compared to competitors overall; in this Department?

children.label: Do they have a strong Private Label image?
children.answer: How willing are shoppers to risk choosing Private Label in this retailer? How does this compare?

nodes.label: How do I refocus my portfolio for success?

children.label: Which segments/brands are the opportunity for growth in this retailer? So how do I win support for them?
children.answer: Do some brands in the category work harder for the store, i.e. are the rated higher on intentionality or engagement? If so, can this be leveraged?”

nodes.label: Retain my most valuable shoppers
Who are my MVS?

children.label: Which shopper types are more profitable because they buy more regularly, are more loyal, and less promotionally oriented?
children.answer: Which shopper types are more profitable because they buy more regularly, are more loyal, and less promotionally oriented? How do we focus on them to improve ROI?

children.label: How does this vary for my brand?
children.answer: Do the shoppers of my brand have a different loyalty  profile to the category norm?

children.label: How does this vary by segment?
children.answer: Do the shoppers of any one product segment have a different loyalty profile to the category norm?

nodes.label: What do we need to change for them?

children.label: What’s important to them, how do they make their decisions and when?
children.answer: Look at MVS Shopper "Importance ratings" how do they differ to the less valuable?

children.label: What do my MVS particularly want improved?
children.answer: What does the MVS shopper want improved and how does this differ to others?

children.label: When do they  make their decisions and why (so when do we influence them)?
children.answer: Are the MVS more planned and what triggers are most critical for them compared to the norm?

nodes.label: Grow the category
How do I bring new shoppers in? (Penetration)

children.label: How do we reduce the barriers to purchase?
children.answer: Is this category more about pre store barriers or in store barriers? If the decision is made before the store then that has to be our focus for growth

children.label: What are the drivers of the category (occasions/needs) and how can we leverage for new users?
children.answer: Who is it being bought for and when is it intended to be used (so where should we seek to influence potential shoppers?)

children.label: What are the drivers of the category (users) and how can we leverage for growth?
children.answer: When is it intended to be used  so how can we exploit that?

nodes.label: How do I get existing shoppers to increase transaction size? (AWOP)

children.label: Who are my current shoppers?
children.answer: Are there certain demographic groups that are more important to my business? Can we bring in more of these or do we need to "grow our base"?

children.label: How satisfied are they today?
children.answer: Are there certain demographic groups that are more satisfied or less satisfied in the category? How do we win over more of the "doubters"?

children.label: What motivates them and what are their “points of pain”?
children.answer: What do shoppers tell us are their priorities in this category? Getting these right is likely to drive growth.

children.label: What do they want improved?
children.answer: Are there certain improvements our shoppers seek more than the norm? How can we deliver that?

children.label: How are they responding to current promotions?
children.answer: Are they demonstrating a willingness to spend more or do our promotions "cupboard load"/reward existing behaviours?

children.label: How well are we keeping them in our "conversion funnel"?
children.answer: Do those shoppers planning to buy a specific brand go on to buy that brand? If not, why not? Are we losing sales?

children.label: Where do I focus for premiumisation? (brand/segment)
children.answer: For which brands do shoppers show a stronger desire for premium offerings? Focussing on these could drive value growth.

nodes.label: How do I get existing shoppers to buy more often? (Frequency)

children.label: How can I best remind shoppers/trigger the need in the path to purchase?
children.answer: Is this category more decided pre or in store? Is it about buying for a change or part of a routine? How do we increase the right trigger points?

children.label: How well are promotions driving incremental sales today?
children.answer: Does the current promotional response show evidence of driving an extra unplanned purchase? If not, why not?

children.label: What do other categories do well?
children.answer: Top 10 on conversion planned to buy - who does this well and why? How do we emulate that?

nodes.label: Improve brand shopper marketing effectiveness
What’s driving the purchase?

children.label: Who are my shoppers?
children.answer: What are my key segments? What do they need from the category?

children.label: What triggers the purchase decision and when?
children.answer: Is this a routine or an occasion driven purchase?

children.label: What users and occasions do they have in mind?
children.answer: How do we target the need behind the purchase?

children.label: How does this differ by brand so how do I best respond?
children.answer: What triggers purchase for my brand shoppers?

children.label: How does this differ by Product segment so how do I best respond?
children.answer: What triggers purchase for key Segments shoppers?

children.label: How does the trip mission vary to the norm?
children.answer: Are we stronger for top up or main shop trips and how should this impact our strategy?

nodes.label: How do shoppers make decisions so where & how do I best influence them?

children.label: What are their priorities?
children.answer: What are my shoppers looking for?

children.label: How brand oriented are they?
children.answer: Are they more loyal or less loyal to the brand and/or the category?

children.label: Do we keep the planned purchase?
children.answer: Where do we "lose" most potential shoppers in the path to purchase?

children.label: How do promotions impact them?
children.answer: What is shopper response to promotions - does it drive an extra sale or substitute for another purchase?

children.label: How do promotions responses differ by brand?
children.answer: Do different brands achieve a different promotional outcome for the category?

nodes.label: Which shopper segments are most attractive?

children.label: What’s different about satisfied shoppers compared to less satisfied?
children.answer: Compare the shoppers giving high sat ratings to low sat ratings, what are the differences?

children.label: What missions are we strong for?
children.answer: If we have a bias to main shopping trips our category may be more "core" to the higher spending shoppers

children.label: How does satisfaction differ for my brand?
children.answer: Are there brand shoppers that are more satisfied? What does that brand do to achieve that?

children.label: How does mission differ for different Brands?
children.answer: Do brands show a different trip mission profile? Does that help us differentiate our shopper marketing activity?

nodes.label: Optimise point of purchase efficiency
Are we satisfying shoppers? What’s working, what’s not?

children.label: How does our category compare to the norm?
children.answer: A lower satisfaction score indicates (relatively) an opportunity to improve.

children.label: What are we doing better or worse?
children.answer: Which measures appear to be behind the satisfaction score (if any)?

children.label: Are we delivering what matters most to our shoppers?
children.answer: For which importance measures is this category below par?

children.label: How does this compare to other retailers?
children.answer: Is this retailer performing worse than its competitors?

children.label: How does this compare to other categories?
children.answer: Is our category peforming worse than other categories overall in this retailer?

children.label: Which categories are doing this better and what can we learn?
children.answer: Which categories lead the way on delivering each performance measure?

nodes.label: How should I adjust range and space in the category?

children.label: What is the shoppers own priority for improvement?
children.answer: What would they prioritise for change? How is this different to the norm?

children.label: What’s particularly important to them?
children.answer: Are choice and new ideas more important or is availability a higher priority? How does this vary compared to the norm?

children.label: Are there segments of shoppers with particular requirements?
children.answer: Can we see one part of the category with different shopper needs?

nodes.label: What Trip missions are present?

children.label: How does the trip mission vary to the norm?
children.answer: Are we stronger for top up or main shop trips and how should this impact our strategy?

nodes.label: How do I optimise the department/aisle?

children.label: How do the categories in the Aisle differ on what shoppers seek and how they buy?
children.answer: Compare our category to others in the Department

children.label: Which are more intentional, which drive spend?
children.answer: Look at where each category in the Department sits on the matrix of intentionality and differentiation. What differences does that imply for strategy?

children.label: How do they differ in shopper range, space and merchandising requirements?
children.answer: Compare importance ratings by departmental categories.
